Posted By: mikato1 (1/19/2010 12:56:27 PM)

posts.post_content:
Because nobody seems to have pointed it out, if you put the flavourtexts in this order:  
1. [Creature Guy](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Creature Guy)  
2. [Save Life](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Save Life)  
3. [Deal Damage](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Deal Damage)  
4. [Spell Counter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Spell Counter)  
5. [Kill Destroy](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Kill Destroy)  
  
You get a nice little rhyme:  
"There once was a player named Quinn, who consistently managed to win. Until he got singed, playing *Unhinged*, getting Gotcha'd again and again."
posts.html:
Because nobody seems to have pointed it out, if you put the flavourtexts in this order:
1. Creature Guy
2. Save Life
3. Deal Damage
4. Spell Counter
5. Kill Destroy

You get a nice little rhyme:
"There once was a player named Quinn, who consistently managed to win. Until he got singed, playing Unhinged, getting Gotcha'd again and again."

posts.post_content:
@Drecon84  
I've noticed that a lot on gatherer. Many names don't have exclaimation points like this, but quite a few flavor text lines are missing the "!" at the end for some weird reason on gatherer. It's not all of them (["Ach! Hans, Run!"](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name="Ach! Hans, Run!") is fine) but a few random ones.
posts.html:

I've noticed that a lot on gatherer. Many names don't have exclaimation points like this, but quite a few flavor text lines are missing the "!" at the end for some weird reason on gatherer. It's not all of them ("Ach! Hans, Run!" is fine) but a few random ones.
